intro: Senegalia ebingeri, commonly known as the desert acacia, is a shrub or small tree native to arid regions of Africa and the Middle East. It is characterized by its slender, often multi-branched stems and bipinnate leaves that are reduced to small, scale-like structures in hot, dry conditions. The plant produces yellow flowers in dense, spherical clusters, followed by legume pods containing several seeds. It is well adapted to harsh environments, with deep root systems that allow it to access groundwater. Senegalia ebingeri plays an important ecological role in stabilizing soils and providing habitat for desert wildlife.
